intro: Elleanthus thomasii, commonly known as the Thomas's elleanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has a low, spreading growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
